Intent.OverallIntent: This is the CRM System Definitions DATASPEC.  It defines key components and functionalities of the CRM system that manages all aspects of a trucking company’s operations to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Must: Provide explanations for core concepts, roles, actions, inputs, and outputs involved in the CRM System, including specific definitions for 'Template' and 'Instance'.
Ensure all definitions enhance understanding of how the CRM system integrates and functions within the trucking company.
Should: Be used in every interaction with the CRM to ensure consistent understanding and application.
Provide clarity and detailed descriptions to help users understand each aspect of the CRM system without ambiguity.
Could: Serve as a foundational training tool for new users or as a reference for existing users.
Be periodically updated to reflect changes in system functionality or company operations.
MustNot: Omit or alter any provided definitions outside of official updates to ensure consistency and reliability in system usage and understanding.

CRM System.description: A software system that manages all aspects of a trucking company’s operations including handling of driver information, truck details, routes, plans, event logging, and operational constraints.

Operational Integrity.description: The correctness and reliability of the CRM’s functionality, ensuring that operational processes adhere to defined rules and constraints.

Audit Trail.description: A secure and traceable log of all significant actions and events maintained for accountability and operational history.

Template.description: A foundational blueprint or framework that defines the structure and elements of particular entities within the CRM system, designed to be reusable and customizable depending on specific needs.

Instance.description: A specific realization or deployment of a 'Template' filled with actual data, embodying the template’s structure in a practical, operational context within the CRM system.

Driver.description: An individual responsible for operating a truck within the fleet, managed within the CRM.

Fleet Manager.description: A role or individual responsible for the overall management of the truck fleet.

System Administrator.description: An individual charged with managing the CRM system and ensuring proper configuration and security.

Routing.description: The process of defining and managing the paths that trucks take from origin to destination.

Scheduling.description: Organizing routes into plans that stipulate when and how resources are deployed.

Logging Events.description: Recording significant activities within the CRM system.

Driver Data.description: Information about drivers including licenses and contact details.

Truck Specifications.description: Details about each truck in the fleet such as make, model, and year.

Route Details.description: Information regarding the start and end points of routes and timings.

Operational Reports.description: Documents summarizing the status of routes, truck utilizations, and driver activities.

Alerts and Notifications.description: Communications issued to inform about important events or actions.

Compliance Summaries.description: Reports detailing adherence to operational constraints and regulatory requirements.
